value.value:
This is the location menu.

UOIT locations can be explored manually using an expanding location menu. Click this button to open it!
value.raw:
'

This is the location menu.

UOIT locations can be explored manually using an expanding location menu. Click this button to open it!'

value.value:
Explore locations on the campus map!

The same locations featured above are layed out on an interactive map, available in this menu.
value.raw:
'

Explore locations on the campus map!

The same locations featured above are layed out on an interactive map, available in this menu.'

value.value:
Not sure where to start?

If you have an idea of something you're looking for, try searching for it.
value.raw:
'

Not sure where to start?

If you have an idea of something you\'re looking for, try searching for it.'

value.value:
The button toolbar below and to the right can be expanded, condensed, or hidden entirely with the buttons to the right-hand side here.

Don' forget to register your user account for future visits or book a real tour at the university!
value.raw:
'The button toolbar below and to the right can be expanded, condensed, or hidden entirely with the buttons to the right-hand side here.

Don\' forget to register your user account for future visits or book a real tour at the university!'

value.value: If you want your preferences saved for future visits, you can configure your own personal settings for the Virtual Tour experience here!
value.raw: 'If you want your preferences saved for future visits, you can configure your own personal settings for the Virtual Tour experience here!'

value.value:
Would you like to learn how to navigate through scenes?
Show me howNo thanks
value.raw:
'Would you like to learn how to navigate through scenes?
Show me howNo thanks
'

Around the Tour, you will find many blue arrows pointing to different areas. They are called scene links; use them to travel.

Move your cursor over a scene link to highlight it, and click it to travel in the direction it's pointing.
value.cooked:
Around the Tour, you will find many blue arrows pointing to different areas. They are called scene links; use them to travel.

Move your cursor over a scene link to highlight it, and click it to travel in the direction it's pointing.

value.raw:
The button on the far-right bar opens the location menu.

Navigate by picking a location; choose a building to list scenes from; click a scene to view it.

Use this menu to jump to a scene or between far-away scenes. Close the menu by clicking the button again.
value.cooked:
The button on the far-right bar opens the location menu.

Navigate by picking a location; choose a building to list scenes from; click a scene to view it.

Use this menu to jump to a scene or between far-away scenes. Close the menu by clicking the button again.

value.raw:
The Tour's built-in Campus Map can be used to navigate the Tour.

The button on the far-right bar opens the Map.

Choose a building on the map by clicking it; click the Take a tour » button in the building info to go to that building's first scene.
value.cooked:
The Tour's built-in Campus Map can be used to navigate the Tour.

The button on the far-right bar opens the Map.

Choose a building on the map by clicking it; click the Take a tour » button in the building info to go to that building's first scene.

value.value: Learn how to use warp arrows, map view and the location menu to move from scene to scene.
value.raw: 'Learn how to use warp arrows, map view and the location menu to move from scene to scene.'

value.value: See which tour elements offer interactivity and how to use them.
value.raw: 'See which tour elements offer interactivity and how to use them.'

value.value: Experience the UOIT virtual tour immersively with an Oculus© Rift.
value.raw: 'Experience the UOIT virtual tour immersively with an Oculus© Rift.'

value.value: Turn your smartphone into a portal to UOIT with a mobile VR peripheral like HTC Vive, Samsung Gear or Google Cardboard.
value.raw: 'Turn your smartphone into a portal to UOIT with a mobile VR peripheral like HTC Vive, Samsung Gear or Google Cardboard.'

value.value: Learn about the options available for fine-tuning the virtual tour interface.
